docs.snippet: Victims of the attacks on Brussels' airport and subway included commuters heading to work, travelers starting long-anticipated vacations, expatriates setting out to visit distant homelands. They came from dozens of nations to a cosmopolitan city t...
docs.lead_paragraph: Victims of the attacks on Brussels' airport and subway included commuters heading to work, travelers starting long-anticipated vacations, expatriates setting out to visit distant homelands. They came from dozens of nations to a cosmopolitan city that's home to the European Union, NATO and other international institutions.

headline.main: Brussels Victims Came From US. Belgium and Around the World

docs.snippet: Paul Samborski and his father, Lenn, were at Winnipeg Arena for the original Jets' final playoff game in 1996 before the team moved to Phoenix. When the NHL returned in 2011, Samborski joined the thousands of fans who signed up for season tickets ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Paul Samborski and his father, Lenn, were at Winnipeg Arena for the original Jets' final playoff game in 1996 before the team moved to Phoenix. When the NHL returned in 2011, Samborski joined the thousands of fans who signed up for season tickets and brought his dad to the new Jets' first home playoff game last year against Anaheim.

docs.lead_paragraph: Major employers in North Carolina have denounced a bill that overturned an ordinance in Charlotte that protected people from discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation.
docs.abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column says over 90 national companies are seeking repeal of North Carolina law eliminating protections for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people; points out corporations have led successful battles against laws seen as sexually discriminating in some of most socially conservative states.

headline.main: Corporations No Longer Sit Idly By on Discrimination
